column1: The swaying had come to a halt and it was dark. The Explorer was not comfortable in the alien air. It felt as thick as soup and he had to breathe shallowly. Even so—He reached out in a sudden need for company. The Merchant was warm to the touch. His breathing was rough
column2: he moved in an occasional spasm
column3: and was obviously asleep. The Explorer hesitated and decided not to wake him. It would serve no real purpose.There would be no rescue
column4: of course. That was the penalty paid for the high profits which unrestrained competition could lead to. The Merchant who opened a new planet could have a ten-year monopoly of its trade
column5: which he might hug to himself or
column7: rent out to all comers at a stiff price. It followed that planets were searched for in secrecy and
column9: away from the usual trade routes. In a case such as theirs
column11: there was little or no chance that another ship would come within range of their subetherics except for the most improbable of coincidences. Even if they were in their ship
